step1.sentence: The best entrepreneurs learn to embrace uncertainty rather than fear it, treating each unknown as an opportunity to innovate.

step2.story: After losing her stable job, Mia decided to embrace uncertainty and launch her own business. She stopped waiting for guarantees and took the leap anyway. Three months later, her small bakery had more loyal customers than she ever imagined.

step3.story: Daniel had always been a planner — color-coded calendars, five-year goals, contingency plans for his contingency plans. But when his research project took an unexpected turn, none of his spreadsheets could save him. His mentor sat across from him in the lab and said quietly, 'The best discoveries happen when you embrace uncertainty.' At first, Daniel resisted the idea. Yet as he let go of his rigid expectations and followed the data wherever it led, something shifted. The experiment yielded results no one had predicted, opening an entirely new line of inquiry. He realized that certainty had never been the goal — curiosity was.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '불확실성을 껴안다'는 뜻으로, 앞날을 알 수 없는 상태를 거부하지 않고 기꺼이 받아들이는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 변화, 도전, 새로운 시작 앞에서 두려움 대신 열린 마음으로 미지의 상황을 수용할 때 사용합니다. 자기계발, 창업, 커리어 전환 등의 맥락에서 자주 등장합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'embrace'는 고대 프랑스어 'embracer(팔로 안다)'에서 유래했으며, 'uncertainty'는 라틴어 'incertus(불확실한)'에서 파생되었습니다. 두 단어가 결합해 '불확실함을 적극적으로 끌어안다'는 뉘앙스를 형성합니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 불확실성을 '참는' 것과 달리, 긍정적이고 능동적인 수용의 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 성장 마인드셋과 관련된 맥락에서 특히 자주 쓰이며, 용기 있는 태도를 암시합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: To grow as an artist, you have to embrace uncertainty and be willing to experiment.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 예술가로 성장하려면 불확실성을 받아들이고 기꺼이 실험해야 합니다.
